citations.narrative:
The meat freezer temperature gauge was not working, the door and door seal were dirty, and the cooling unit had a large
icicle built up and resting upon bags of frozen parts of carcasses, which appeared to be partially frozen together due to a
buildup of drips from the cooling unit. Food must be stored under sanitary conditions and at appropriate temperatures or
the food may deteriorate, become contaminated, or mold. The facility must ensure that the food is stored appropriately.
Correct by end of day 04/11/2023.

The wolf enclosure had an accumulation of discarded pelts, bones and hair from prey along the fenceline and rock
climbing structures. Timely removal of wasted food items is necessary to ensure that animals are not exposed to disease
hazards. The facility must ensure that waste materials are disposed of promptly in a manner that does not attract vermin.
Correct by end of day 4/5/2023.

Two tall trees have fallen over the fence to cross it in an x formation, reducing the height to less than 8 ft. Perimeter
fences function to restrict animals and unauthorized persons from entering the facility and serve as a secondary
containment system for the animals in the facility. The facility must ensure that the perimeter fence is kept in good repair.
Correct by end of day 4/5/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The meat freezer temperature gauge was not working, the door and door seal were dirty, and the cooling unit had a large 
icicle built up and resting upon bags of frozen parts of carcasses, which appeared to be partially frozen together due to a 
buildup of drips from the cooling unit.  Food must be stored under sanitary conditions and at appropriate temperatures or 
the food may deteriorate, become contaminated, or mold.  The facility must ensure that the food is stored appropriately. 
 
Correct by end of day 04/11/2023. 
3.125(d) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The wolf enclosure had an accumulation of discarded pelts, bones and hair from prey along the fenceline and rock 
climbing structures.  Timely removal of wasted food items is necessary to ensure that animals are not exposed to disease 
hazards.  The facility must ensure that waste materials are disposed of promptly in a manner that does not attract vermin.   
 
Correct by end of day 4/5/2023. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor.

Two tall trees have fallen over the fence to cross it in an x formation, reducing the height to less than 8 ft.  Perimeter 
fences function to restrict animals and unauthorized persons from entering the facility and serve as a secondary 
containment system for the animals in the facility.  The facility must ensure that the perimeter fence is kept in good repair. 
 
Correct by end of day 4/5/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
